doc.repnme: Africa - Regional Communications Infrastructure Program Third Adaptable Program Loan Malawi Project : technical annex
doc.abstracts: The objective of the Malawi Project of the Regional Communications Infrastructure Program Third Adaptable Program in Africa is to overcome a major bottleneck for the communications networks in Malawi access to the coastal landing stations of the submarine cables. There are three components to the project. The first component of the project is enabling environment. This component will provide support to the overall enabling environment for the project. This includes project specific activities and general support for the sector. There are three sub-components to this component. The first sub-component is capacity building an advisory support to sector agencies. This subcomponent will provide technical capacity building and monitoring and evaluation (M&E) assistance to the agencies of Government involved in the Information and Communication Technology (ICT) sector. The second sub-component is environmental, social and resettlement activities. The activities to be undertaken as part of this project are unlikely to have any major environmental or resettlement implications. The third sub-component is communications. This component will cover communications activities including a combination of project promotion among private-sector participants and public outreach activities. The second component of the project is connectivity. This component will support regional and international connectivity in Malawi through three major subcomponents: The first sub-component is Public Private Partnerships (PPP) for regional connectivity. This subcomponent will support regional connectivity to link Malawi with coastal landing stations of the submarine cables which are due to be completed by 2010. The second sub-component is enabling the establishment of a Virtual Landing Point (VLP). The key to the success of the project will be ensuring that the private sector in Malawi all have equal access to the regional connectivity provided under the project. The third sub-component is supply of broadband connectivity to institutions/rural access. This component will finance last mile connectivity to selected public institutions and Public Internet Access Points (PIAPs) within Malawi, to be provided by private operators and Internet Service Providers (ISPs) operating within the country. The third component of the project is project management. This component will consist of support to finance project management related issues: (a) a project manager; (b) a technical expert; (c) a procurement specialist; (d) a financial management specialist; (e) office equipment; (f) audits; and (g) other operating expenses.
